alert.note: Alert for Nassau (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 02 at 7:49PM EST until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Florida, including the following counties, Baker, Duval and Nassau. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 748 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain from previous thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, Arlington, Atlantic Beach, Neptune Beach, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Normandy, Cisco Gardens, Ortega, Riverside, San Marco, Bryceville, Craig Field, Baldwin, Jacksonville Heights, Whitehouse Air Field and Tallyrand. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
